intro: Tomodon pratense, commonly known as the meadow tomodon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread across various habitats.
